sentence.text: Induction of P-glycoprotein by rifampin increases intestinal secretion of talinolol in human beings: a new type of drug/drug interaction.
P-Glycoprotein is an efflux pump in many epithelial cells with excretory function
It has been demonstrated that rifampin (INN, rifampicin) induces P-glycoprotein, particularly in the gut wall

We therefore hypothesized that rifampin affects pharmacokinetics of the P-glycoprotein substrate talinolol, a beta1-blocker without appreciable metabolic disposition but intense intestinal secretion in human beings
